snippet: New studies suggest that geographical circumstances may have hidden the extent of the bird kill caused by the BP oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico, though the effort also illustrates the imprecise science involved in quantifying the toll.
abstract: Team of scientists studying effect of Deepwater Horizon oil spill on bird populations in Gulf of Mexico estimates that 800,000 birds died in accident, number far higher than 3,000 recovered carcasses; number is based on models using publicly available data and assumes that ocean currents carried most carcasses away from site; BP has disputed number.
lead_paragraph: New studies suggest that geographical circumstances may have hidden the extent of the bird kill caused by the BP oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico, though the effort also illustrates the imprecise science involved in quantifying the toll.

headline.main: Still Counting Gulf Spill’s Dead Birds
headline.print_headline: Still Counting Gulf Spill’s Dead Birds
